column4: is there a way to check the disk from the live cd
do you mean to list all the disk? or to checkdisk it?
if that's the case.... then do as Kjell suggest you....
you realy sure that /dev/sda1 block is an ext2?
do you have /boot directory in /dev/sda3? what's in it?
yes, but ithought he want to install grub? i think ubuntu will get the best result if he install it from grub prompt, using chroot, mount the /dev and /proc
my problem is that my pc doesn't c the boot menu, which has fedora nd windows, so now i'm using ubuntu live cd to try to fix this problem :)
yes, i realize that..... and you want to install the boot loader, right?

do as Kjell told you, then here's the general steps, first ,mount your fedora / into let's say, /media/sda3/, mount /dev into /media/sda3/dev, mount /proc into /media/sda3/proc, chroot into /dev/sda3, open grub prompt, thn install...
